To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?<RF>chiefâ€¦: or, overseer<Rf>
How long shall I take counsel in my soul, <FI>having<Fi> sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
Consider <FI>and<Fi> hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the <FI>sleep of<Fi> death;
Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; <FI>and<Fi> those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
I will sing unto the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.<CM>
